Credentials
Enter the credentials for your Infinity Touch / Evolution Connex / Ion Comfort account that is linked to your thermostat.

Don't have an account?
If you have not already done so, you need to create an account and link it to your thermostat. You can create an account at these links:
  • Carrier Infinity
  • Bryant Evolution
  • ICP Brands Ion (including Airquest, Arcoaire, Comfortmaker, Day&Night, Heil, Keeprite, Tempstar)

Hold Behavior
Control how changes made via HomeKit interact with the activity schedules of your thermostat. More details.

Temperature Control
Temperature and mode controls for your thermostats are always shown.

Activity Control
Show Touch-n-Go controls for comfort activities and manual holds.

Fan Control
The Fan control is a slider with the following steps:
  1. Auto (0%)
  2. Always On Low (33%)
  3. Always On Medium (66%)
  4. Always On High (100%)
More details.
Show additional environmental sensors in HomeKit.
Show the thermostat's environmental sensors as discete sensors in HomeKit (as opposed to only being shown as part of the thermostat accessory in HomeKit).

To reduce instances where HomeKit and your thermostat are out of sync (i.e. HomeKit's data is stale), specify the number of attempts HomeKit should make to get up-to-date data from your thermostat. Each attempt takes ~1 second. A large number of failed attempts can increase HomeKit's reponse times. Consider the tradeoff between responsiveness and accuracy of the data. Local testing shows it typically takes <3 seconds to get up-to-date data.
